result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case in court for a status of counsel. No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 10-10-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defendant is requesting Attorney Graber withdraw from thje case.  Court will allow Attorney Graber to withdraw. Case is adjourned to  9-13-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties advise of resoultion. Defense request additional date. Court grants. Defense request to be heard on bail. State advises able to proceed. Arguments heard. Court orders removal of justice point monitoring. Case adjourned in Branch 4.

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in  court for jury trial. State's essential witness is NOT present in court, therefore, the State is unable to proceed today on counts 2 and 3.  No alternative theory.  Motion to dismiss by the defense argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Case dismissed without prejudice counts 2 and 3.  State prepared to proceed on count 1. Case passed to address other trial calls.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Court lowers JusticePoint supervision to Level 4. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Kentreal Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's Bail Motion heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court lowers JusticePoint supervision to Level 4. All other conditions of bail remain the same.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 7/11/2022 at 8:30 am, Courthouse Room 504.
filed.

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Jury trial is scheduled for 5-16-22 at 8:30 am. Defense is requesting an adjournment.  State does not object.  Jury trial set for 5-16-22 is vacated.  Defense is requesting a bail review to lower the Justice Point monitoring level.  Case is adjourned to  6-21-22 at 8:30 am for a bail review as to Justice Point monitoring and 7-11-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Admission of 911 Recording; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defendant has entered a speedy trial demand.   Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 4-28-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 5-16-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.

filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires 5/26/2022.

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Kentreal Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Dexter Lee, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones not in court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court denied defense motion to modify bail. Case remains scheduled for preliminary hearing on 2-25-22 at 8:30 am in Prelimary Hearing Court.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Daniel Kentreal Jones in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Kentreal Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Court STRIKES incorrect "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
